history.content:
Since you've taking EE16B right now, I would say that taking Math54 is a waste of space for your next semester. That being said, I can definitely understand where you are coming from, as I felt uncomfortable with the math parts of EE 16A last semester and decided to take Math 54 this semester to prepare for EE 16B next semester. Here's what I would do: MATH 54 can be self-studied and there are many resources to help you out with this. This semester, Paulin has posted his notes and videos for his notes on his website: https://math.berkeley.edu/~apaulin/54_002(Spring2018).html

Tl;dr It would be better to lightly review relevant concepts in Math 54 that build your mathematical maturity for CS 70, CS 189, or other math heavy classes.

children.subject: Also see Dominick's post in @6567, you could probably consider taking Math 110 to solidify your linear algebra understanding.

history.content:
I'm in L&S, intending to declare CS, and I'm interested in taking upper division courses that may require a very strong grasp of math. I'm currently taking EE16B and I honestly am a little concerned that I won't come out of this class with too high of a grade, or with enough solid foundation of math to prepare me for the future (not necessarily because the class is bad. It's just that I have a hard time understanding the concepts).

Should I take Math 54 next semester/sometime in the future to prepare for upper divs? Or is that not worth it and it would be easier to lightly review the relevant concepts before taking upper divs?
history.subject: Taking Math 54 after EE16A/B
